body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find largest 2 digit prime factor of number    "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \\frac{ 200! } { (100!)^2}  "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, the prime "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boldsymbol {\mathbb P} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to be present at least 3 times in the factor of the "},{"type":"text","text":"numerator 200!","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" we get, 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{\mathbb P\leq \frac{200}{3}} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{\Rightarrow \mathbb P\leq66.67}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
And the largest prime number smaller than "},{"type":"text","text":"66.67","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"text","text":"61","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, the answer will be, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#69047E} {\boxed {61}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

title: 2001 Problem!
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f \\left( \\frac 1{2001} \\right) + f \\left( \\frac 2{2001} \\right) +  f \\left( \\frac 3{2001} \\right) +\\cdots +  f \\left( \\frac {2000}{2001} \\right) "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x) = \\dfrac 2{4^x+2} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for "},{"type":"text","text":"real numbers","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Evaluate the expression above."}]}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Just note that 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" f(x) + f(1-x)=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Now pair up the terms."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            As suggested by "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":"@Abhishek Sinha"}],"attrs":[{"profile":"https://brilliant.org/profile/abhishek-y363sq/"}]},{"type":"text","text":": "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} f(x) & = \frac 2{4^x+2} \\ \implies f(1-x) & = \frac 2{4^{1-x}+2} \\ & = \frac 2{\frac 4{4^x}+2} \\ & = \frac {4^x}{2+4^x} \\ & = \frac {4^x+2-2}{4^x+2} \\ & = 1 - f(x) \\ \implies f(x) + f(1-x) & = 1 \\ \implies f \left(\frac 1{2001} \right) + f \left(\color{#3D99F6}{\frac {2000}{2001}} \right) & = 1 & \small \color{#3D99F6}{\text{As } 1-\frac 1{2001} = \frac{2000}{2001}} \\ f \left(\frac 2{2001} \right) + f \left(\frac {1999}{2001} \right) & = 1 \\ f \left(\frac 3{2001} \right) + f \left(\frac {1998}{2001} \right) & = 1 \\ ... & \quad \ ... \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\implies f \left(\frac 1{2001} \right) + f \left(\frac 2{2001} \right) +f \left(\frac 3{2001} \right) +...+f \left(\frac {2000}{2001} \right) = \boxed{1000} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: 2002 Math OSK, Number 10: Digit values
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The digits 1, 9, 9, 8 in 1998 has a total value of 1 + 9 + 9 + 8 = 27. The next number that has a total digit value of 27 happens between years of..."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Python"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"codeBlock","content":[{"type":"text","text":"for n in range(1998,5000):

    s = sum(map(int,str(n)))

    if s== 27:

        print (n,s)
"}],"attrs":[{"text":"for n in range(1998,5000):
